moves.5. d3 g6 6. Be3 Bg7 7. Nc3 e6: Mistake, the correct move was 7... b6
moves.8. Bxc5 b6 9. Be3: White is one pawn up but has moved the bishop three times, so that it partly compensates for black
moves.9... Ne7: Inaccuracy : 9... Nf6 would have been better ( if 10. e5 Nd7) In this place, with fiancheto, the knight blocks the queen.
moves.11... O-O 12. h4: White's intention is clear and black should beware about white attack on the kingside
moves.12... Bd7: misatake (it blocks the queen and a control of the a8-h1 diagonal would have been better
moves.13... b5 14. hxg6: Black has 3 possibilities but none is satisfying.
moves.14... fxg6: 14. ... Nh6 would probably have been better (the queen would have been free to come in reinforcement)
moves.17... Kf7: Forced move (if 17... Kf5 18. Qg5 mate) - if the e knight had occupated another square, black would have had more options.
moves.19. Ne4: White need more material for the mate (again, if black had set his LSB on the big diagonal, white would have had to find something else)
moves.20. Qxg6+: But white has now enough material available to do the job. ( Note : Black's LSB on d7, blocking the escape route for the king)
moves.20... Rf7: The other option 20... Ke7 lead to mate even quicklier (21. Rh7+ Kf8 or Ke8 22. Qxf8+mate)
moves.21... Qe7: The only other available move was 21... Nd6 22. Nxd6+ with mate to follow
moves.24. Qxf7#: Thanks for the game, mediochrejelly. I've learn that knight on e7, in case of a fiancheto is something to avoid.
